author: abdellatifLabr
body:
commands autocomplete is not cleared well after executing the command. if the autocomplete length is more than one line, it's not fully cleared.
here is the autocomplete line appears and abviously it's more than 1 line
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17796722/85200939-528d2400-b2f3-11ea-81fe-3662ee732169.png)

and when i execute the ls command, the rest of the autocomplete is not cleared.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17796722/85200975-9a13b000-b2f3-11ea-8bb1-869faf11762d.png)

I'm using Windows Terminal 1.0 & Powershell 7.0.2 on Windows 10 version 1909

it happend also on the normal powershell windows, so it's not a Windows Terminal issue
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17796722/85201026-fa0a5680-b2f3-11ea-8c6e-386440cb7df0.png)

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
Can you check without PSReadline? (Remove-Module PSReadline)

/cc @daxian-dbw

comments.author: abdellatifLabr
comments.body:
@iSazonov 
Yes, the error doesn't happen when i remove PSReadline, but there's no autocomplete at all.

title: Autocomplete is not cleared if it's more than  line
